method.text: Preheat oven to 190°C. Lightly grease 6 x 7.5-10 cm ramekin dishes.
To make the puddings, pour the milk into a pan with 75 g of sugar, double cream and vanilla essence. Whisk well until boiling. Take off the heat.
Beat the egg yolks with the remaining sugar until blended. Stir in 4-75 ml of the hot milk.Blend in evenly. Pour the egg yolk mixture into the milk in the pan.
Return the pan to the boil, whisking constantly for about 4-5 min, until the consistency of the mixture resembles thin custard. Remove from the heat.
Add the chocolate to the mixture. Stir well until the chocolate melts. Add the bread. Mash mixture to a mushy consistency.
Fill the ramekins evenly with the mixture. Fill a roasting tin with hot water. Place ramekin dishes in the roasting tin. Cover with foil. Cook in oven for 45 min.
Carefully remove the foil. Brush puddings with the butter. Return to the oven for 9 min, until pale golden brown.
While cooking the puddings, melt the butter in a large non-stick pan. Stir in the sugar. Simmer for 2 min.
Stir in the bourbon (or whisky) and cook for 2 min. Remove from the heat and whisk in the egg. Strain sauce through a sieve.
Serve puddings hot in a puddle of whisky sauce.
